bill_title: provide that certain submissions constitute waiver of the right to change a hearing examiner in certain contested cases regarding workers' compensation.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide that certain submissions constitute waiver of the right to change a hearing examiner in certain contested cases regarding workers' compensation. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 62 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding § 62-7-12.2, the submission to a hearing examiner of argument or proof in support of a motion or application constitutes a waiver of the right thereafter to file an affidavit for change of the hearing examiner by any party or the party's counsel who submitted the affidavit. The waiver shall continue until the final determination of the action and includes all subsequent motions, hearings, proceedings, and all proceedings to enforce, amend, or vacate any order. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide that certain submissions constitute waiver of the right to change a hearing examiner in certain contested cases regarding workers' compensation. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 62 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding § 62-7-12.2, the submission to a hearing examiner of argument or proof in support of a motion or application constitutes a waiver of the right thereafter to file an informal request to disqualify the hearing examiner by any party or the party's counsel who submitted the argument or proof. The waiver shall continue until the final determination of the action and includes all subsequent motions, hearings, proceedings, and all proceedings to enforce, amend, or vacate any order. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
